IMPORTANT INFORMATION ABOUT THIS LICENSE AND VERSION

This DLC is exclusively for Shapelab 2024 owners. By purchasing this upgrade, you can enhance your Shapelab experience with the latest features of Shapelab 2025 and receive complimentary updates on Steam until the end of 2025. To use Shapelab 2025, you must have Shapelab 2024 installed. Ensure both the Shapelab 2024 base app and the Shapelab 2025 upgrade DLC are installed together.

If you are not yet a Shapelab owner, please choose the package called "Shapelab," which includes both the Shapelab 2024 base app and the new Shapelab 2025 upgrade DLC. Ensure you download and install both the Shapelab 2024 base app and the Shapelab 2025 DLC together, and avoid using Shapelab 2024 on its own.

SHAPELAB 2025 DLC DESCRIPTION - CHANGES, NEW FEATURES, FIXES, AND IMPROVEMENTS

Customizable Environments

  • Use various environment settings to test and showcase your creations in different lighting and atmospheric conditions.

  • Import HDRIs or set up custom colors to personalize your Skybox, Ambient Light, and Environment Reflections.

  • Configure directional light settings to suit your needs.

  • Toggle the workspace floor on or off as required.

  • Save and load your custom environments for future use.

  • Go to Options → Environments → and click "New" to get started.

Redefined Parametric Primitives

  • Enhanced and fully updated parametric shapes, previously found under “Sculpt Stamp Brush” and “Create Tool.”

  • Includes new UI, presets and additional parameters like bevel, chamfer, taper, and hole.

  • Updated mesh preview.

Gesture-Based Primitive Reshaping

  • Use controller gestures to reshape the selected primitive in your Create Tool (scene mode) or Stamp Tool (edit mode).

  • Press the thumbstick on your primary controller, hold it down and move your controller around to adjust XYZ scale values and the overall size of the shape.

Custom Fixed Shapes and Templates for Kitbashing

  • Fully customize what shapes you are spawning with the Create Tool.

  • Add selected 3D objects to your shape library for use with the Create Tool. While this functionality is currently limited to the Create Tool, we are exploring ways to integrate it with the Sculpt Stamp feature without compromising stability or performance.

  • Directly import objects into your shape library from your device (.OBJ, .FBX) or add selected shapes from the scene.

  • Additionally, we provided a number of predesigned fixed shapes for use with the Create Tool.

Cursor Snapping by Angle and Grid

  • Apply angle and grid snapping constraints to your Create Tool or Sculpt Tool cursors for a more organized workflow.

  • Use the same constraints when grabbing and moving objects to simplify arrangements.

  • Customize increments and coordinate spaces to suit your specific needs.

  • Tilt your secondary controller towards you to open the collapsible snapping constraints menu. All settings are synced with the Context Menu’s Transform Tab.

Dynamic Brush Sizing by Scene or View

  • A new brush scaling option adjusts the cursor size relative to the scene, ensuring consistent brush stroke sizes regardless of zoom level.

  • When enabled, the brush size remains constant relative to the model, making it easier to maintain uniformity. It’s especially useful when frequently zooming in and out while sculpting.

  • This feature is particularly valuable for 3D Stamping objects of the same size or spawning uniformly sized items with the Create Tool while navigating and zooming around in a 3D space.

  • Press the newly added settings button next to the brush size slider to toggle between size handling options.

Navigation Settings, Scene Grab

  • You can now enable simultaneous scene and object grabbing, which automatically disables pinch scaling gestures for objects.

  • This feature complements the option to customize what your dominant grip button does when pressed in the void while in scene mode: grab the scene, grab the selected object, or do nothing.

  • Additionally, you can now adjust the Thumbstick Scaling Sensitivity, which influences both brush scaling and the speed of object resizing when using the thumbstick while the object is grabbed.

  • Go to Options → VR Settings → Controls to customize the default settings.

Scene Alignment Tools

  • Below the Snapping features, you'll find three new scene alignment tools for quick adjustments:

  • Reset Zoom: Resets the scene's root scale to its default value.

  • Fit Scene: Adjusts the zoom level to ensure the entire content fits within view.

  • Upright Lock: Instantly aligns the scene upright and locks it, preventing any changes through controller gestures or navigation.

  • Tilt your secondary controller towards you to open the collapsible snapping constraints menu. All settings are synced with the Context Menu’s Transform Tab.

Improvements and Fixes

  • Context Menu: The Open/Close animation has been removed, and auto-positioning has been improved and simplified.

  • The app now remembers the last used display and relocates itself to the correct screen on launch.

  • Improved Import/Export with fixes, such as resolving scale issues in hierarchized FBX models.

  • The export process no longer generates 0KB files when interrupted.

  • Fixed the visual issues in the file browser's thumbnail view.

  • Resolved the issue where the export file browser's UI wasn’t refreshing properly.

  • Fixed visible cracks on objects with certain materials and shading setups.

  • The brush cursor can now be made much more visible than before. Find the configuration options under Options → Desktop / VR settings.

  • The animation under the Context Menu’s Transform tab is now hidden in tooltips to save space.

  • The Create Tool and Stamp Tool shape preview visualization has been improved and now auto-hides when the user isn't hovering over the UI.

  • The Stroke Spacing checkbox under the Brush modifier panel’s Stroke settings, which was malfunctioning, now works properly.

  • Gizmos no longer dynamically rescale with objects in VR.

  • Updated Outliner UI.

  • Fixed an issue with Windows Mixed Reality thumbstick, which consistently signaled a value, triggering scrolling and pull/push actions without user input. This has been resolved with a higher threshold.

  • The Steam version of the launcher automatically quits when the Shapelab app is closed.

  • Each selection correctly sets the active object, ensuring the most recently selected one is always active.

SHAPELAB GENERIC DESCRIPTION

Shapelab is a highly efficient 3D sculpting application primarily optimized for virtual reality that also supports desktop-based work with digital pens, allowing users to switch between the two modes on the fly. It offers a variety of industry-grade tools to create highly detailed 3D assets and optimized low-poly models. Visualize your creative ideas and print them in 3D or sculpt high-quality props, characters, and concepts for applications, games, and virtual worlds, as well as digital concept art and storyboards.

Shapelab leverages VR technology to offer an immersive and intuitive sculpting experience, enabling you to work seamlessly in 3D space with unparalleled control and creative freedom. You can easily navigate in 3D, interact with your designs as they were right in front of you. With your VR controllers, you can move, scale, adjust focus, and create 3D brushstrokes naturally, easily shaping complex designs with simple hand movements. This level of immersion is impossible to achieve in traditional desktop software and can boost productivity, allowing you to work faster, more efficiently, and often with greater precision. 

Shapelab’s proprietary, robust polygon mesh-based design engine enables sculpting stunning, detailed, and realistic 3D assets, as well as importing and editing large and complex 3D scans.

Join our community of artists and unleash your creativity with Shapelab today!

Please note that although you can register a Shapelab account after downloading Shapelab, an account is not needed to access the application. To create an account, you only need to provide an email address and a password. Tick the 'Remember me' checkbox to stay logged in. You can provide additional information and manage your email preferences in your account settings.

SHAPELAB CORE FEATURES

VR and Desktop Modes
Run Shapelab on your PC in desktop mode or use a VR headset tethered to your PC for an immersive VR experience. Switch seamlessly between modes while working on your projects. 

Digital Pen and Tablet Support
Leverage the power of your digital pen and tablet with tilt, twist, and pressure sensitivity. Compatible with both Wintab and Windows Ink for precision sculpting. 

Advanced Sculpting Tools
Access industry-standard sculpting tools with extensive configuration options. Brushes include Clay, Standard, Mask, Crease, Smooth, Pinch, Inflate, Snakehook, Flatten, Trim, Regularize, and 3D Stamp. 

Dynamic Topology Sculpting (Optional)
Enable real-time tessellation to dynamically adjust mesh detail based on your needs. Alternatively, lock your brush resolution to a specific value by sampling directly from your model for precise sculpting control.

Customizable Work Environments
Personalize your workspace: 

  • Import custom HDRI skyboxes or use solid colors and gradients. 

  • Configure ambient lighting, reflections, and directional light settings. 

  • Toggle the workspace floor on or off as needed. 

Kitbashing with Custom Shapes and Primitives  

  • Build efficiently using a built-in library of fixed shapes and parametric primitives.  

  • Or use your custom models added to your shape library for quick scene population.  

Precision Tools: Snapping and Constraints  

  • Grid and angle snapping for organized creations and constraints for more precise alignments.  

  • Tools for you to quickly align and reset the scene to cycle through perspectives. 

Multiresolution and Subdivision Levels

Subdivide your mesh to create multiple levels of detail. Easily switch between them to optimize your workflow. 

Detail Transfer (Projection)
Transfer intricate details from high-resolution, unorganized meshes to cleaner, quad-based models. 

PBR Vertex Painting and Texture Export 

  • Paint Color, Roughness, Metalness, and Emission properties directly onto your models. 

  • Export texture maps, including normals, PBR properties, and vertex colors, during the export process. 

Remeshing and Mesh Transformations 

  • Voxel remesh, subdivide, decimate, and regularize meshes. 

  • Perform operations like mirroring, welding, flipping, and filling holes. 

  • Merge vertices and quad remesh for cleaner topology. 

Scene Management Streamline your workflow with: 

  • Object hierarchy organization through parenting. 

  • Clone, mirror, merge, subtract, intersect, and join objects. 

  • Multiselect and group objects for batch operations. 

  • Gizmo and freehand transformations for objects and scenes. 

Materials and Shading 

  • Use PBR materials, MatCaps, and procedural textures. 

  • Import custom MatCaps or utilize built-in ones. 

  • Flat shading support for stylistic effects. 

File Support and Import/Export

Easily import and export models in FBX, OBJ, STL, and GLB formats.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS *: Windows™ 8.1 or later or Windows™ 10
  • Processor: Intel™ Core™ i5-4590 or AMD FX™ 8350, equivalent or better
  • Memory: 8 MB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce™ GTX 1060 or AMD Radeon™ RX 480, equivalent or better
  • Storage: 800 MB available space
  • VR Support: OpenXR-based, compatible with Meta Quest Link and SteamVR

short_description: Owners of the Shapelab 2025 DLC will receive updates throughout the 2025 calendar year and gain access to features such as custom environment configurations, the ability to use custom shapes for kitbashing, and various 3D alignment and constraint tools.
